channel.title: Website Registration (Server Sided & Website)
channel.description:
Hello guys,
Does anyone has a tutorial that people only can log in when they register at the forums?
Best of thanks, Tijs.

item.title: Website Registration (Server Sided & Website)
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“SGTCannon, post:6, topic:384508”]Another thing that I have against it is that that way, people aren’t allowed to make pures or skillers or something if they want that on a seperate account.

If you decide to do this, I suggest that you put the client download link only where registered users can see, that way they can ONLY download the client once they have registered for the forums, or make it so that in the forum validation e-mail, there is a link to the client download. That is probably the most simple way of doing it, and it allows people to make multiple accounts and whatever name they choose. [/quote]You could create an additional table if someone wanted to create a second account, then have the skiller linked to the forum user by their ID. That would limit it to 2 accounts per person.

item.title: Website Registration (Server Sided & Website)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“SGTCannon, post:4, topic:384508”]Basically, you just need to create a validation system on your forums, in which they once they validate VIA e-mail, you PM them the login information on an account of their choice.

I wouldn’t recommend doing this, most people would consider it an incredible hassle, and just choose another server.

Also, I’m 95% sure that this is client-sided.[/quote]
Not at all client sided!

k0isk0:

Can you give me some code so i know how?

You need to connect to your forum database using JDBC, assuming you run your server on the same host as your forums (or have remote database access to your forum host). There are plenty of tutorials and examples on JDBC.

When a user attempts to login, run a query which searches for a user with this username+password. If you’re using SMF, I can give you the query.
